page.title:
Section 508 Background
Section 508 Background
page.enlisting:
• The legal basis for Section 508 . . . – The Workforce Investment Act of 1998 amended Section – When developing, procuring, maintaining, or using – Above requirements must be met unless to do so would 508 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 – Members of the public with disabilities seeking information or services from an agency must have access to and use of information and data that is comparable to that for members of the public without disabilities • The legal basis for Section 508 . . .

page.title:
Section 508 Background
Section 508 Background
page.enlisting:
• Why we should care about Section 508 . . . – While Section 508 Is The Law, it is a law whose intent makes sense and whose thoughtful implementation will benefit federal agencies, their employees, and the public – Federal agencies must do more with fewer resources: we need the best from all our employees, including those with disabilities – Support for NASA’s programs requires buy-in from all segments of the American public, including citizens with disabilities • Why we should care about Section 508 . . .
• Why we should care about Section 508 . . .
– While Section 508 Is The Law, it is a law whose intent makes sense and whose thoughtful implementation will benefit federal agencies, their employees, and the public – Federal agencies must do more with fewer resources: we need the best from all our employees, including those with disabilities – Support for NASA’s programs requires buy-in from all segments of the American public, including citizens with disabilities – While Section 508 Is The Law, it is a law whose intent makes sense and whose thoughtful implementation will benefit federal agencies, their employees, and the public

page.title:
Section 508 Requirements for Web Pages
Section 508 Requirements for Web Pages
page.normal_text:
• Sixteen Section 508 Web requirements – Some are relatively straight-forward: “A text equivalent for every non-text element shall be provided”
• Sixteen Section 508 Web requirements
– Some are relatively straight-forward: “A text
equivalent for every non-text element shall be
provided”
page.enlisting:
– Others are trickier and are still being interpreted: “When a web page requires that an applet, plug-in or other application be present on the client system to interpret page content, the page must provide a link to a plug-in or applet that complies with (requirements for software applications and operating systems)” – Headquarters and others (e.g., GSA) have prepared – Key: follow the standards; do not rely solely on tools – Others are trickier and are still being interpreted:
– Others are trickier and are still being interpreted:

page.title:
NASA Web Requirements for Section 508
NASA Web Requirements for Section 508
page.enlisting:
• NASA CIO issued on June 19, 2001, policy for compliance of NASA web pages with Section 508 – Provides guidance for both new and existing web pages – Establishes waiver process for undue burden – Requires Center-level plans to address bringing web • Initial plans due September 30, 2001 • Plan updates due every six months afterwards – Policy was not prescriptive on plan format and level of – Submitted Center plans were generally good but varied • NASA CIO issued on June 19, 2001, policy for
• NASA CIO issued on June 19, 2001, policy for
compliance of NASA web pages with Section 508 – Provides guidance for both new and existing web pages – Establishes waiver process for undue burden – Requires Center-level plans to address bringing web
